definition: to slaughter livestock/to govern or rule/to cheat customers/imperial official in dynastic China

sentences.english: Some small traders at this tourist spot are notorious for their overcharging customers.
sentences.chinese: 這個旅遊景點的一些小商販以宰客而臭名遠揚。

sentences.english: This saleswoman is trying to rip off the customer.
sentences.chinese: 這個女銷售員的行爲即時宰客。

sentences.english: If you rip me off, I'll come back and ask for a refund.
sentences.chinese: 被我發現你宰客的話，我就回來找你補差價。

sentences.english: The lack of a meter made drivers rip off passengers.
sentences.chinese: 出租車沒有裝計程器，司機就會“宰客”。

definition: to refuse to take a passenger (of taxi)
to force sb to buy or sell/to trade using coercion
to solicit (guests, clients, passengers etc)/to importune
unlicensed or unofficial taxi/unlicensed motor vehicle
person who joins with others to reduce costs (carpooling, group buying, sharing an apartment etc)
to run the meter (in a taxi)
lit. inn that kills and robs guests (esp. in traditional fiction)/fig. a scam/protection racket/daylight robbery
